titleInfo.title: Studio portrait of Dora Corrine Adams Johnson, circa 1910s or 1920s

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: Black and white copy photograph of a studio portrait of Dora Corinne Adams Johnson seated at an angle. Photograph appears to be made in the late 1910s or early 1920s. Dora Corinne Adams Johnson (1882-1952) was the daughter of Samuel Adams and Elmirah Adams. Samuel Adams was born into slavery in South Carolina and Elmirah is belived to be a Native American. Dora Corinne Adams Johnson was born in 1882, and was a member of St. James CME in Collierville, Tennessee, a church founded by her father. She later attended Mt. Pisgah CME in Orange Mound, Memphis, Tennessee. At both churches she acted as a Stewardess, assisting in giving communion during church services. She died in 1952 and is buried at St. James CME Church Cemetery in Collierville, Tennessee.

titleInfo.title: Generations - African American Women's Early Activism in Tennessee
